precedence_of_law.rank: Project Mandates and Constraints (generated at project init)
Kit Discovery Engine (when kit is active)
Kit Activation Rules (when kit is active)
Kit Patterns and Checklists (when kit is active)

element.name: Origin
element.definition: The singular intent of the system.
element.requirements: Must define the North Star, Non-Goals, and Constraints.
element.paradigm_lock: Must declare if the project is an App (Logic-First) or Site (Content-First).

element.name: Mandates
element.scope: Includes Never-Do lists, Halt Conditions, and the Circuit Breaker protocols.

element.name: Environment
element.definition: The operational reality and file structure.
element.state_rule: The system must maintain STATE.md to track the current Letter and Phase. If STATE.md is missing, execution halts.

element.name: Governance
element.definition: Control of dependencies, capabilities, and supply chain.
element.install_gate: No tool may be installed unless declared in deps.md with a version pin and reason.

element.name: Awareness
element.definition: The system's memory and context connection.
element.mechanism: Links NotebookLM/LLM context to the project's source of truth. The system must distinguish between known facts and assumptions.

element.name: Function
element.paradigm_a: Apps: Logic, Data Schema, APIs, Auth.
element.paradigm_b: Sites: Content Strategy, Sitemap, Information Architecture.
element.rule: Function must be proven (via tests) before UX begins.

element.name: Observation
element.rule: It works is invalid. Here is the log/screenshot is valid.

element.name: Repair
element.protocol: Analyze Error, Patch Code, Retest, Update SOP. Never fix the same bug twice without updating the process.

element.name: Motion
element.scope: Navigation, F-Patterns, Friction reduction, Error states.
element.rule: UX optimizes the use of the Function.

element.name: Uniformity
element.scope: Naming conventions, directory structure, reuse patterns.

element.name: Look
element.rule: Applied last. Cannot fix broken Function or poor Motion.

element.name: Archive
element.action: Validated assets are moved to the Vault. Release artifacts are tagged.

element.name: Thresholds
element.rule: No Phase MVP build begins without an approved PRD defining Acceptance Criteria.
element.timebox_rule: Every PRD must define a Time Appetite (Effort Box). If the timebox expires, work halts for re-evaluation.

element.name: Abstraction
element.rule: INTERFACES.md defines the strict boundary between internal logic and external usage. Anything not listed there is not a contract.

element.name: Control
element.scope: Rollback plans, Environment promotion (Dev to Prod), and Kill Switches.
element.kill_protocol: A project/phase may be intentionally terminated (Killed) if constraints change. This is a valid system state, distinct from failure.

element.name: Knowledge
element.rule: Every major decision or discovery must be logged.

element.name: Absorption
element.action: Validated ideas promoted to a Phase PRD.

element.name: Exposure
element.rule: Frontend/Backend Split. No keys in client.

element.name: Enforcement
element.rule: HALT condition on any security ambiguity.

protocol.name: Circuit Breaker (Anti-Loop)
protocol.category_tuned_limits: See QUALITY.xml for per-category attempt limits (E1:2, E2:3, E3:4, E4:3, E5:1/HALT, E6:3, E7:2). Default Rule of 3 applies if unclassified.
protocol.new_hypothesis: Never repeat a failed action identically.
protocol.halt: If limit reached, generate STOP REPORT and wait for human decision.

protocol.name: Version Control Doctrine
protocol.atomic_commits: Changes must be isolated and verifiable.
protocol.tagging: Releases must be tagged for rollback.

protocol.name: Legal Surface
protocol.requirement: legal/ folder must be initialized (Privacy, Terms, License).
protocol.constraint: Legal mandates (e.g., Data Deletion) are treated as Functional Requirements, not documentation.
